Inter’s shock Europa League exit could prompt the departure of Gabigol, Jonathan Biabiany, Stevan Jovetic, Felipe Melo and Davide Santon.

The Nerazzurri crashed out of the tournament in the group stage for the first time, having lost four of their five games so far.

A 3-2 defeat at Hapoel Be’er-Sheva on Thursday was the final nail in their continental coffin.

According to La Gazzetta dello Sport, failing to qualify for the next round has cost the club €15m and the squad will be cut down to size accordingly.

Jovetic, Melo and Biabiany have been on the exit list for a while, but Santon is also apparently on the market for the right price.

Inter invested €29.5m to sign Gabriel ‘Gabigol’ Barbosa from Santos in August, but he has made just one Serie A appearance for 16 minutes.

Frank de Boer said Gabigol was “not ready” to play in Italy and new Coach Stefano Pioli seems to agree.

In the circumstances, a loan spell at a smaller Serie A side for six months would give the youngster some much-needed experience.

Pescara are the most likely club to take him on, though Empoli and Bologna are also options.

Gasp: 'Inter damaged me'

“The three-man defence there was seen as repugnant,” Gasp

“I wasn’t at the club long enough to do damage. If anything, Inter did damage to me. It was very satisfying afterwards to finish above Inter in the table with Genoa.”

He’s on track to repeat the trick, as Atalanta are currently in joint fourth place, seven points above the Nerazzurri.

Gasp worked at the Juventus youth academy, but came close to the main Turin bench too.

“I twice had contact, when they were in Serie B and then during the era of Alessio Secco and Jean-Claude Blanc.

“I will always be grateful to Juve because that club transmitted values that today might seem anachronistic: discipline, sense of belonging, a respect for your roles and your opponents.

“What I learned there, I tried to pass on to players as a Coach.”

stefano pioli
Stefano Pioli spoke to the microphones of Sky in the post-match Inter-Fiorentina:

“We had many opportunities to score before the fourth goal. Fiorentina have kept their players in the field of quality. The suffering helps us grow. We have done so many positive things, we are working on others. The decline stems on many factors: The team needs trust, we must keep the team short, and occupy the field well. As soon as we stretch we are risking exposure in the defense.

“The balance comes from the work you do together on concepts and positions. It’s unthinkable not to give credit to a quality team like Fiorentina. In the second half, we could not hold possession in the midfield despite the numerical advantage. You have to find awareness and stay compact for 95 minutes, then the results will come. I removed Kondogbia because he was already booked and did not want to frustrate the referee. I inserted a technical player like Joao Mario to move the ball and give many solutions.”

“There is also a bit of fear in managing the advantages: We hold the ball longer and maintaining stamina becomes difficult. The win is important, we came from a bad game. 3-2 players were concerned, but we are working both on physical condition. There is so much for improvement and reach the point at which the players will manage to play well for 90 minutes. Zhang gave me a great impression: he spoke to me first and then to the team, with great clarity.”

Source: Sky Sports

Melo: ‘Staying at Inter’


Felipe Melo insists “I haven’t had any contact” with Flamengo or Sao Paulo, and assures “I’m happy at Inter”.

The Brazilian midfielder has been linked with a return to his homeland, after he struggled for playing time under Frank de Boer.

However, following the Dutchman’s sacking and the arrival of Stefano Pioli, the 33-year-old has featured against Hapoel Be’er Sheva and Fiorentina.

“I’ve read these stories in the newspapers,” Melo told UOL Esporte.

“They said that I asked for too high a salary from Flamengo, but I never received an offer from them. There was contact with them in the past, but I’m happy at Inter now.

“I’m getting a chance with the new Coach now.

“I have a special affection for the Sao Paolo fans, and not just today. It’s an honour to be linked with these two clubs, who it’s impossible to say no to.

“But, I repeat, I’ve haven’t had any contact. No offer. I have a contract with Inter for another year and a half.”

FCIN: The agent of Gabigol: “He’s not happy at Inter because he never gets to play. In January? A loan deal possible, but…”

Wagner Ribeiro, agent of Gabriel Barbosa took a tough stand when being interviewed about his client in Radio Bandeirantes. “Gabriel isn’t happy at the moment. We’re not talking about the locker room or about teammates. It’s a question of never getting the opportunity to play. In January we want this issue to be resolved. De Boer, just before being sent away told Kia Joorabchian that there was no problem with Gabriel, but now Pioli, just like the dutchman, doesn’t offer the Brazilian any chance to play. If you don’t come on to the pitch when you’re down by three goals when will you ever play?”

Ribeiro then continued with explaining that a return to Santos isn’t impossible. “There is a possibility that he returns in Brazil in 2017, even if it’s a tough choice: for him it would be a step back, a failure.”

After the precious victory against Lazio, Inter now prepare to focus exclusively on the transfer market, with an essential question to answer: Who to sell to raise cash?

Sponsors Suning will help to bridge some of the gap in the budget with a 25M Euro injection required to meet FFP, Sky Sports report. The clubs worldwide plan, including the merchandising is projected to have Inter breaking even, even with Suning’s injection, UEFA will still be keeping a close eye on any winter moves.

Potential departures are; Andreolli, Jovetic, Santon, Gabigol and Melo. Loans will not bring much-needed revenue, while a separate discussion must be done for Kondogbia, whose convincing performance against Lazio plays in favor of the Nerazzurri in two ways, both for the self-esteem growth and for the increase of appeal to other clubs who may aspire to buy the Frenchman.

Incoming, in early 2017, Inter will work with loans, especially for the midfield. Investing in profiles like Verratti, who is not a problem for Suning, if anything, now the ‘trouble’ is having to hold back until June.

Inter on the hunt for a midfielder. Lucas Leiva, Luiz Gustavo, Badelj: the situation

Inter is looking around for a new holding midfielder to bring in, in January. The order is to bring in a player without spending: a dry loan. Nothing has done yet but Inter ds. Piero Ausilio has been looking at diverse players and has talked to a range of agents. The feeling at the moment is that the first club to accept a loan will be the current club of the player Inter is to sign. This is because all the players Inter are looking at have already given the ok: Lucas Leiva, Luiz Gustavo and Lass Diarra (who has a release clasue which would make him available for 0). The problem for Inter is convincing the club: Liverpool and Wolfsburg have not warmed up to the idea of a loan with option to buy yet, which is the only possible way to bring in the midfielder. A loan with obbligation would count as a full-out signing in the eyes of Financial Fair Play. Another name on the list Obi Mikel: probably the easiest player to sign, yet the one Inter officials are least convinced by. A different topic altogether is Badelj: A player Inter would bring in immediately, but Fiorentina is not open to the idea of letting him go. Badelj is also tied to Jovetic: Jovetic has offers from Germany (Melo from Brazil) and Inter would only be open to a loan abroad. If Jovetic were to stay in Italy, Inter would like to sell him outright: A clear signal to Fiorentina so they can set up a deal with Badelj included and a "no" to Milan's loan proposal for Jo-Jo.

Inter, Gabigol: “I will not return to Brazil; I am happy here. San Siro? It was amazing”

Gabigol managed to show some promise during the ten minutes he played against Lazio. It took only a few plays for Gabigol to solicit applause and enthusiasm from all the fans in San Siro. It was an unexpectedly strong show of support which surprised the Brazilian himself: “I am happy for how the last game went. It was a special moment for me. The stadium was amazing. No one becomes a starter after immediately arriving. There are great players in Italy; but no one has my style, and I must adapt.”

He will have time to adapt in 2017 as he will certainly remain at Inter: “I will not return to Brazil. I am very happy at Inter. I have been in Milan for three months, and I am adapting.

rano傳緊最大機會過去搵馬沙利踢波
走埋啦

對於Jojo，除咗可惜之外就係祝福。

喺重建二期，即馬沙利後，文仙尼第一個夏季轉會重點後購。起初佢同伊卡迪拍檔可以話係將運氣同個人實力發揮得淋漓盡致，射入一球一球世界波奠勝，加上伊卡迪射門觸角，加埋3M1H後防，將一隊無form嘅垃圾波國米同文仙尼推上聯賽第一。

所以引入Jojo同大家預期差一樣，同伊卡迪組重球隊火線，橫掃意甲。但都同大家預期一樣，遇上傷患，低潮之下離隊。

只可惜後來傷完又傷，好返嘅時候，文仙尼已經唔再用佢，而同時唔再需要佢。後來易帥，佢都唔能夠取得位置，甚至被迪保亞排除於球隊計劃之外，就算後備上陣亦都表現唔到自己，只係覺得佢同球隊格格不入，再無機會打得起。

其中一個原因係佢喺433搵唔到適合嘅位置，作為前鋒身後嘅影子、攻中，實在無容身之所。另一個原因就係球員特點 : 慢、Hold波耐、上腳、回防率較低，所以喺主張側重兩翼進攻、力氣消費型中場、簡單快速嘅國米，佢嘅特點實在難以生存。即使係同伊卡迪合作初期，佢地都係依賴於個人實力助勝，兩個或球隊合力產生嘅化學作用實在相當少，學Uwants位師兄所言，佢地係1+1=2，而做唔到1+1>2。反之，昔日拍檔伊卡迪就受球隊重用，愈打愈有，幾年意甲、國米數據王。

國米清洗前鋒，一來係為咗解決鋒線滿人之患，相對於艾達同柏拉嘅特點，同埋年輕自家產品Pinamonti ( 加比高就算啦 )，放棄佢係最合理嘅選擇，二來係夏季大力增兵嘅前戲。即使留喺國米，佢亦都唔能夠爭取到位置。所以與其留隊，不如換個環境，打返起個狀態，同西維爾、國米創造三贏。學Jojo自己話齋To restart career。承佢嘅祝福， Forza Inter, ciao Jojo
